page.title: 06CUSTOMS OF MARSTON MAGNA.
page.content: Every June a garden party is held in the Manor grounds or by the church attended by most of the villagers.75% of the profits are given to the church and the remaining 25% is sent to a different charity each year. Local school children give a demonstration of Maypole and Country Dancing.There are also the usual stalls and games. On the first Monday in October a Harvest Supper is held in the village hall.All the food given is auctioned and the money raised is donated to a charity.A village concert is held in November and the Women's Institute and the British Legion perform a play.Any local people who wish to join in can and at the end there is a sing song. Everybody meets on the Village Green on the 21st or 22nd of December to go around the village carol singing.The money raised is given to a charity.
